intro: Ouratea congesta, commonly known as the clustered ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
